channel.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
channel.description:
[b]EDIT: Solved, Thanks guys.[/b]
Hey guys, I'm wanting to know if there's a way for players to leave messages for me in-game when I'm not online with a ::leavemessage command. I know this is possible because I've had this command on another server I used to run, but I haven't been able to find anything on it. Basically, what I want to do is have a .txt file that the ::leavemessage command saves messages to, like a messages.txt file.
The command works like this: ::leavemessage Hi, I've found a bug at this x/y coord: 3464, 4274.
If someone could help with this, that'd be great. Thanks.

item.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Lil_Smok3r:

Mrpopyman, take a look at how ::report commands work since they’re kind of similar (::report saves it to a .txt file)

That command is a HORRIBLE example… At least with mine you can use it for different types of logging…

//Assuming you put the log method in PlayerAssistant
c.getPA().log("reports", "Lil_Smok3r gave a bad example");

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Mrpopyman, take a look at how ::report commands work since they’re kind of similar (::report saves it to a .txt file)

NVM, found this on R-S; take a look and see how it works:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("report") && playerCommand.length() > 7) { try { BufferedWriter report = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./Data/Reports/Reports.txt", true)); String Report = playerCommand.substring(7); try { report.newLine(); report.write(c.playerName + ": " + Report); c.sendMessage("You have successfully submitted your report."); } finally { report.close(); } } catch (IOException e) { e.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

mrpopyman:

So how do I make a command for this and where do I put this?:

Put that method in a class.
And then take a look in your commands file, you have a few dozen commands, at least. See how it works…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

So how do I make a command for this and where do I put this?:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:548303”]You want to save it to a text file? dude. EASY…

[code=java] private static void log(String fileName, String message) {
String path = “./Data/logs/” + fileName + “.txt”;
try {
if (new File(path).exists() == false)
new File(path).createNewFile();
} catch (IOException e1) {
System.out.println("[LOGGING]Could not make " + fileName + “.txt”);
}
try (BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(
path, true))) {
bw.newLine();
bw.write(message);
bw.close();
} catch (Exception e) {
Misc.out("Error logging message: " + message);
}

}

[/code]

Now make a command for it.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:548303”]You want to save it to a text file? dude. EASY…

[code=java] private static void log(String fileName, String message) {
String path = “./Data/logs/” + fileName + “.txt”;
try {
if (new File(path).exists() == false)
new File(path).createNewFile();
} catch (IOException e1) {
System.out.println("[LOGGING]Could not make " + fileName + “.txt”);
}
try (BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(
path, true))) {
bw.newLine();
bw.write(message);
bw.close();
} catch (Exception e) {
Misc.out("Error logging message: " + message);
}

}

[/code]

Now make a command for it.[/quote]
You don’t want to make an object each time though.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @mrpopyman mrpopyman
item.description:
@mrpopyman wrote:

runescape sucks:

You could do it whenever they use that command it saves it to a List, and whenever you login it loops through that list and sends you all the messages then clears it. Then if you’re online, it just sends you the message instead of saving it to the list.

Yeah, but I wanna know how to do that, haha :P.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ::leavemessage [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

You could do it whenever they use that command it saves it to a List, and whenever you login it loops through that list and sends you all the messages then clears it. Then if you’re online, it just sends you the message instead of saving it to the list.

Read full topic

Hey guys, I’m wanting to know if there’s a way for players to leave messages for me in-game when I’m not online with a ::leavemessage command.
